Events.RelatedDescription: Closed issue "Unable to Create Custom Icon Set for Conditional Formatting" (#1783) at dotnet/Open-XML-SDK
Closed issue "System.IO.Packaging version 8.0.0 transitive reference issue via DocumentFormat.OpenXml version 3.1.0 - CVE-2024-43483, CVE-2024-43484" (#1806) at dotnet/Open-XML-SDK
Events.RelatedBody:
**Describe the bug**
I encountered an issue with a transitive reference to System.IO.Packaging version 8.0.0 when using DocumentFormat.OpenXml version 3.1.0. The package reference appears as a warning in the NuGet package manager (screenshot attached).

**Screenshots**
![Image](https://github.com/user-attachments/assets/e9cadcaa-365f-4e47-baf8-6e7dbffc2ea2)
![Image](https://github.com/user-attachments/assets/47f7793a-4ed3-4f1c-a422-9d63dacd71f1)


**To Reproduce**

Steps to reproduce the behavior:
1. Add `DocumentFormat.OpenXml` version 3.1.0 to the project.
2. Observe the transitive dependency on `System.IO.Packaging` 8.0.0 in the package manager.

**Observed behavior**
A warning is displayed in the NuGet package manager.

**Expected behavior**
No warning or a clear explanation of the transitive dependency being safe to use.

**Desktop (please complete the following information):**
 - OS: Windows 11, Alpine 3.20.3
 - .NET Target: .NET Core 8
 - DocumentFormat.OpenXml Version: 3.1.0

Events.RelatedDescription: Merged pull request "Update System.IO.Packaging to 8.0.1" (#1808) at dotnet/Open-XML-SDK
Opened pull request "Update System.IO.Packaging to 8.0.1" (#1808) at dotnet/Open-XML-SDK
